properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Traffic Hazard Alert For Hwy 16 West Of Wildwood
properties.Summary:
Description: Westbound traffic on Highway 16, west of Wildwood in Yellowhead County between Range Road 100 and Hwy 753, is being rerouted due to a motor vehicle incident. Vehicles travelling in this area need to be cautious of the highway closure and emergency responders on scene as well as traffic being rerouted due the incident. ### Go to www.511.alberta.ca for up to date Road Report information.
Expires: 2019-11-24T05:34:12-07:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Yellowhead County, 2019-11-17T05:32:04-07:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6108
Area: Yellowhead County
properties.Author: Yellowhead County

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Roseau River From Gardenton To Stuartburn
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-11-18T16:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-11-17T15:24:38-06:00, B165A632-E6E9-1120-A1E7-F9C4DCF391C4
Area: Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wind gusts near 100 km/h continue over parts of southwestern Alberta. Winds are expected to weaken late this afternoon. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-18T07:34:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-17T20:56:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2622132272.2019
Area: M.D. of Ranchland, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Cowley Burmis and Maycroft, Piikani Reserve, Municipality of Crowsnest Pass including Coleman and Frank, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Beauvais Lake Prov. Park, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Pincher Creek and Twin Butte, Waterton Lakes Nat. properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of pollutants are expected and will result in poor air quality. High concentrations of pollutants are expected to persist into Monday morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. In Quebec, wood heating is the main source of fine particles that contribute to smog during winter. This activity generates the largest number of these particulates, more than industrial activities and transportation. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-11-18T18:28:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2019-11-17T23:30:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4075091961.2019
Area: Saint-Jérôme area, Lachute area, Saint-Eustache area, Longueuil - Varennes area, Laval area, Montréal Island area, Châteauguay - La Prairie area, Soulanges area, Vaudreuil area, Saint-Rémi area, Valleyfield - Beauharnois area, Hemmingford area, Huntingdon area, Berthierville - Saint-Gabriel area, Rawdon - Joliette area, Mascouche area, Louiseville area, Matawin - Mauricie National Park area, Lac-aux-Sables area, Shawinigan area, Sainte-Anne-de-la-Pérade area, Trois-Rivières area, Portneuf area, Valcartier - Stoneham area, Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area, Saint-Lambert area, Lotbinière area, Sorel - Yamaska area, Saint-Hyacinthe - Acton Vale area, Verchères - Beloeil area, Saint-Jean - Marieville area, Lacolle area, Bécancour - Villeroy area, Victoriaville area, Nicolet area, Drummondville area, Lac-Etchemin area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area, Saint-Georges-de-Beauce area, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard easing this evening. A strong low pressure system over Foxe Basin has been giving northerly winds as high as 60 gusting 80 km/h to Naujaat since last evening with blizzard conditions and near zero visibility. Conditions should slowly improve this evening as the low weakens and winds start to diminish. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-18T06:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-17T21:03:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0985140200.2019
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong easterly winds gusting up to 100 km/h are expected to develop Monday evening and persist overnight. ### Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-18T18:50:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-18T02:51:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1479890175.2019
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. An area of high pressure entrenched over the Mackenzie basin combined with a low centre near the BC/Yukon border is producing strong winds and blizzard conditions to the Dempster highway near the Richardson Mountains. The blizzard will ease this evening as the winds continue to diminish. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-18T05:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-17T23:52:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3565481165.2019
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada
